content.question: Suppose that the economy is in a recession. In the absence of government policy action to restore the economy to full employment, how will the economy adjust in the long run?

choices.label: The <math alttext="S R A S 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SRAS</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> curve shifts to the left as nominal wages decrease and full employment is restored.

The <math alttext="S R A S 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SRAS</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> curve shifts to the right as nominal wages increase and full employment is restored.

The <math alttext="S R A S 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SRAS</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> curve shifts to the left as nominal wages increase and full employment is restored.

The <math alttext="S R A S 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SRAS</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> curve shifts to the right as nominal wages decrease and full employment is restored.

The <math alttext="A D 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> curve shifts to the left as nominal wages decrease and full employment is restored.

content.answer: The <math alttext="S R A S 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SRAS</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> curve shifts to the right as nominal wages decrease and full employment is restored.
